alert.note: Alert for Bee; Jim Wells; Live Oak; Nueces; San Patricio (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 9:29AM CDT until April 23 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Nueces County in south central Texas... Northwestern San Patricio County in south central Texas... Northeastern Jim Wells County in south central Texas... Southeastern Live Oak County in south central Texas... Southwestern Bee County in south central Texas... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 929 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Beeville to near Mount Lucas to near Midway, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Beeville, Robstown, Mathis, Skidmore, Orange Grove, Lake City, San Patricio, Lagarto, Alfred-South La Paloma, Bluntzer, Banquete, Tynan, Westdale, Sandia, Argenta, Mount Lucas, Alfred, Dinero, Agua Dulce and Lakeside. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 25 and 55. US Highway 181 between mile markers 586 and 600. US Highway 59 between mile markers 692 and 714. US Highway 77 between mile markers 672 and 674. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Jim Wells; Live Oak; Nueces; San Patricio
